body: i believe adding Changed (Parent) to the visibility propogate may fix this.. feel free to chime in
You should try it and make a PR :)

how can i test it in my game?  i tried this to no avail 

```
[patch.crates-io]
bevy = { git="https://github.com/ethereumdegen/bevy" , rev = "1b2afeb4b"   }
```
Normally I just set the dependency path to a local folder which the modified version of bevy instead of pointing it to git. See the `path` property.

issue.title: fix visibility propagation during reparenting

labels.name: A-Rendering
labels.description: Drawing game state to the screen

labels.name: S-Ready-For-Final-Review
labels.description: This PR has been approved by the community. It's ready for a maintainer to consider merging it

repository.name: bevy
repository.description: A refreshingly simple data-driven game engine built in Rust

issue.body:
# Objective
Fixes #17024 

## Solution
 

## Testing
 By adding 

```
if let Some(mut cmd) = commands.get_entity( *equipment_link_node ){
                         cmd.insert(Visibility::Inherited); // a hack for now 
                     }

```
in my build after .set_parent() , this fixes the issue.  This is why i think that this change will fix the issue.  Unfortunately i was not able to test the Changed (parent )  , this actual code change, because no matter how i 'patch', it breaks my project.  I got super close but still had 23 errors due to Reflect being angry.  


---

body:
Yeah no matter how i set up patch, it errored.  I got it super close to where it only had 23 errors but they were all related to Reflect.  [Imo the bevy ecosystem should have a better guidelines related  to how to 'patch' a local copy of bevy because its insanely difficult in a project with 40 dependencies and it shouldnt be. I even deleted cargo lock each time ]     Anyways i made this PR 

https://github.com/bevyengine/bevy/pull/17025  

Hopefully someone else can test it .  The fact that my inserting Visibility fixes the issue leads me to believe that this patch will fix it.   I have a hunch that .set_parent just doesnt cause that function to re-run even though it should imo
Bevy doesn't have specific instructions for testing local changes with a test project because it isn't any different from any other rust library crate.

Hmm. well apparently i need to learn more about rust patching because no matter what i do i cant get the patching to work -- it seems like its "reflection" that is messing it up for me somehow.  so, anyways. sad.
